intro: Campanula rapunculus var. calycina, commonly known as the bellflower or bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
